title: Desktop not able to decrypt data; dead end
body:
### Description

*Type*: Bug

*Summary*: Had issues ~on the nightly~ [after downgrading to alpha](https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/7573) yesterday, so I uninstalled and reinstalled [alpha](https://status-im.ams3.digitaloceanspaces.com/StatusIm-181224-165548-797a3a-release.dmg), and now can't log in to Status. This error is now blocking me on any build I try, including [nightly](https://status.im/nightly/). 

#### Expected behavior
I can log in and recover my account. 

#### Actual behavior
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15470435/53397485-87ab8f80-39a7-11e9-9d61-5426f71bc6b6.png)

Both options are a dead end - nothing happens. The app flashes when I click the buttons but the error remains.

### Reproduction
- Installed alpha on top of previous build (I believe it was a nightly)
- Had [issues connecting & migration error](https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/7573)
- Uninstalled and reinstalled alpha release build
- Came to this error
- Uninstalled and downloaded nightly
- Same error
that looks like a pretty serious issue :(
Glad you caught this @mandrigin - I'm struggling on every version I try now :(

@rachelhamlin @mandrigin in the case it can be helpful, when I encountered this error I always cleaned up data. 
AFAIK this is the only way because we didn't support downgrades and for testing purposes we have possibility to run several instances (details are here https://github.com/status-im/status-react/pull/6666).

Okay, so here's where I'm at...

I've uninstalled Status and removed Status folder from ~/Library (MacOS).
Reinstalled and run Status and still same error.

I seem to remember there being additional files to delete when troubleshooting on Mac. Is there something more you can think of @churik? Reading your comments in #6666, but it doesn't seem I have to rename the files.
@rachelhamlin can you send us the logs? there might be an error line and we might be able to understand better what's going on. Thanks!

https://github.com/status-im/status-react/pull/6666 is for future usage - you don't need to use your real data for testing, so it is much easier to create separate db and use PR or nightly or any experimental build with stable build simultaneously.

Please, try to do:
- delete your status app completely form `Applications`
- delete your Status data inside ` ~/Library/Application\ Support/`
- in terminal:
 `rm ~/Library/Preferences/im.status.StatusDesktop.plist`
 `killall -u $USER cfprefsd` 
- reboot your mac
- try to install nightly again

Hopefully, it will help (it helped Hester few days ago).
@churik thank you—following these instructions now.
thanks @rachelhamlin I think we need Status.log @churik do you know where it is on Mac? (also not sure will be populated if logs are not enabled)

Ah no, I have them under Application Support after all. Thanks @churik. @cammellos, it's a huge file, so here they are: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1VsgVJfWs2K0hSNuKuIuNGsdSrRpEJ5rT/view?usp=sharing
Meet Google Drive – One place for all your files
Google Drive is a free way to keep your files backed up and easy to reach from any phone, tablet, or computer. Start with 15GB of Google storage – free.

@rachelhamlin did you clear your `Status` folder under `Application Support`?
So it is empty and contains only `Status.log`?

@cammellos 

`11:11:26.192 - D - [default] - invoked RNKeychainManager::setUsername with username =  "status-im.encryptionkey"
11:11:26.195 - D - [jsserver] - [status-im.utils.handlers:34] - Handling re-frame event:  :hardwallet.callback/on-retrieve-pairing-success
11:11:26.196 - I - [jsserver] - [status-im.data-store.realm.core:124] - realm: moving all realms
11:11:26.200 - W - [jsserver] - [status-im.data-store.core:25] - Could not move realms TypeError: re-matches must match against a string.
11:11:26.201 - D - [jsserver] - [status-im.data-store.realm.core:199] - Opening base realm... (first run)
11:11:26.202 - I - [jsserver] - [status-im.data-store.realm.core:177] - migrate-realm
11:11:26.205 - W - [jsserver] - [status-im.init.core:43] - Could not decrypt database Error: Unable to open a realm at path '/Users/rachelhamlin/Library/Application Support/Status/default.realm/default.realm': Realm file decryption failed.`

Looks like the important part is ` Could not move realms TypeError: re-matches must match against a string.`
Yoooo, that worked @cammellos! Deleted `default.realm` and restarted Status, and I can now recover my account. THANK YOU!

Just to document what happened once I did recover, I ended up with an endless `Signing you in...` screen, so quit again.

Reopened and my account had been recovered for me; I entered my password.

Got this error (which we could improve copy on):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15470435/53412568-ff8ab180-39c9-11e9-9fa5-69d7663cd752.png)

And was initially unable to see, start or join any chats:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15470435/53412641-2c3ec900-39ca-11e9-9c1c-3a871d44d663.png)

But after quitting and restarting once more, I now appear to be safely back at square one, with some message history coming through! 🎉

@cammellos can you confirm that it was migration error and cleaned up data inside `Application support/Status` should fix it?
For possible future requests.
@churik yes, looks like it was due to dowgrade, and cleaning up the dir fixed
@rachelhamlin if you don't mind I'll close it. Reopen it if it is still relevant to you.
